div.ab: (base) Here bigynneth Chaucers tale of Melibeus

(base) A yong man whilom called Melibeus myghty and
riche bigat vp on his wif that called was Prudence a
doghter which that called was Sophie

(base) vp on a day bifel that
he for his desport is went in to the feeldes hym to pleye

(base) his
wif and eek his doghter hath he laft inwith his hous of which
the dores weren faste yshette
(base) thre of his olde foos han it espied and setten laddres to the walles of his hous and by wyndowes ben entred

(base) and betten his wif and wounded his doghter with
fyue mortal woundes in fyue sondry places

(base) this is to seyn
in hir feet in hir handes in hir erys in hir nose and in hir
mouth and leften hire for deed and wenten awey

(base) Whan Melibeus retourned was in to his hous and seigh al this meschief he
lyk a mad man rentynge his clothes gan to wepe and
crye

(base) Prudence his wyf as ferforth as she dorste bisoughte hym of
his wepyng for to stynte

(base) but nat for thy he gan to crye and
wepen euere lenger the moore

(base) This noble wif Prudence
remembred hire vp on the sentence of Ouyde in his book that
cleped is the remedie of loue wher as he seith

(base) he is a fool
that destourbeth the moder to wepe in the deth of hir child
til she haue wept hir fille as for a certeyn tyme

(base) and thanne
shal man doon his diligence with amyable wordes hire to reconforte and preye hire of hir wepyng for to stynte

(base) for which
reson this noble wyf Prudence suffred hir housbonde for to
wepe and crye as for a certeyn space

(base) and whan she say hir
tyme she seyde hym in this wise Allas my lord quod she
why make ye your self for to be lyk a fool
(base) for sothe it aperteneth nat to a wys man to maken swich a sorwe

(base) yowre
doghter with the grace of god shal warisshe and escape

(base) And al were it so that she
Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
right now were deed ye ne oghte nat as
for hir deth youre self to destroye

(base) Senec seith the wise man
shal nat take to greet disconfort for the deth of his children

(base) but
certes he sholde suffren it in pacience as wel as he abideth the
deth of his owene propre perrsone

(base) This Melibeus answerde anon
and seyde What man quod he sholde of his wepyng stynte
that hath so gret a cause for to wepe

(base) Ihus crist oure lord hym
self wepte for the deth of lazarus his freend

(base) Prudence
answerde Certes wel I woot attempree wepynge is no thyng
defended to hym that sorweful is amonges folk in sorwe but
it is rather graunted hym to wepe

(base) The Apostle Poul vn to
the Romayns writeth Man shal reioysse with hem that maken ioye
and wepen with swich folk as wepen
(base) but thogh attempree wepyng be graunted outrageous wepyng certes is defended

(base) Mesure
of wepyng sholde be considered after the loore that techeth vs
Senec

(base) Whan that thy freend is deed quod he lat nat thyne eyen
to moyste ben of terys ne to muche drye al thogh the teerys
come to thyne eyen lat hem nat falle

(base) And whan thou hast
forgoon thy freend do diligence to geten another freend and
this is moore wysdom than for to wepe for thy freend which
that thou hast lorn for ther Inne is no boote

(base) And therfore if ye
gouerne yow by Sapience put awey sorwe out of youre herte

(base) Remembre yow that Ihus Syrak seith A man that is ioyous and
glad in herte it hym conserueth florisshynge in his age but
soothly sorweful herte maketh his bones drye

(base) he seith eek
thus that sorwe in herte sleeth ful many a man

(base) Salomon
seith that right as Moththes in the Shepes flees anoyeth
to the clothes and the smale wormes to the tree right so anoyeth sorwe to the herte

(base) wher fore vs oghte as wel in the deth
of oure children as in the losse of oure goodes temporels haue
pacience

(base) Remembre yow vp on the pacient Iob whan he
hadde lost his children and his temporel substance and in his body
Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
endured and receyued ful many a greuous tribulacion yet seide
he thus
(base) Oure lord quod he hath yeue it me

(base) Oure lord hath biraft it me right so as oure lord
hath wold right so it is doon yblessed be the name of oure
lord

(base) To thise forseyde thynges answerde Melibeus vn to
his wif Prudence Alle thy wordes quod he been sothe and
ther to profitable but trewely myn herte is troubled with this
sorwe so greuously that I noot what to doon

(base) lat calle quod
Prudence thy trewe freendes alle and thy lynage whiche that
ben wise telleth youre cas and herkneth what they seye in conseylynge
and yow gouerne after hir sentence

(base) Salomon seith werk
alle thy thynges by conseil and thow shalt neuere repente

(base) Thanne by the conseil of his wyf Prudence this Melibeus leet
callen a greet congregacioun of folk

(base) as Sirurgiens Phisiciens
olde folk and yonge and somme of hise olde enemys reconsiled as
by hir
semblant to his loue and in to his grace

(base) and ther with al ther
coomen somme of hise neghebores that diden hym reuerence moore
for drede than for loue as it happeth ofte

(base) Ther coomen also
ful manye subtile flaterers and wise Aduocatz lerned in the
lawe
(base) And whan this folk togydre assembled weren this Melibeus in sorweful wise shewed hem his cas

(base) and by the manere
of his speche it semed that in herte he baar a cruel Ire redy to
doon vengeance vp on his foos and sodeynly desired that the
werre sholde bigynne

(base) but nathelees yet axed he hir conseil
vp on this matere

(base) A Sirurgien by licence and assent of swiche
as were wise vp roos and vn to Melibeus seyde as ye may
heere

(base) Sire quod he as to vs Sirurgiens aperteneth that we
do to euery wight the beste that we kan where as we be withholden
and to oure pacientz that we do no damage

(base) wher fore it
happeth many tyme and ofte that whan twey men han euerich
wounded oother o same Sirurgien heeleth hem bothe

(base) wher
fore vn to oure Art it is nat pertinent to norice werre
Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
ne parties
to supporte

(base) but certes as to the warisshynge of youre doghter
al be it so that she perilously be wounded we shullen do so ententif bisynesse fro day to nyght that with the grace of god she
shal be hool and sound as soone as is possible

(base) Almoost right
in the same wise the Phisiciens answerden saue that they
seyden a fewe wordes moore

(base) that right as maladyes
ben cured by hir contraries right so shal man warisshe
werre by vengeance

(base) hise neghebores ful of enuye hise
feyned freendes that semeden reconsiled hise flaterers

(base) maden
semblant of wepyng and empeyred and agregged muchel
of this matere in preisynge gretly Melibe of myght of
power of richesse and of freendes despisynge the power
of hise Aduersaries

(base) and seyden outrely that he anon sholde
wreke hym on hise foos and bigynne werre

(base) Vp roos thanne an Aduocat that was wys by leue and by conseil of othere
that weren wise and seyde

(base) Lordynges the nede for the which
we ben assembled in this place is ful heuy thyng and an
heigh
matere

(base) by cause of the wrong and of the wikkednesse that
hath be doon and eek by reson of the grete damages that in tyme
comynge been possible to fallen for the same cause

(base) And ek
by reson of the grete richesse and power of the parties bothe

(base) for
the whiche resons it were a ful greet peril to erren in this matere

(base) Wher fore Melibeus this is oure sentence we conseile
yow abouen alle thyng that right anon thow do diligence in
kepynge of thy propre persone in swich a wise that thow ne wante noon espye ne wacche thy body for to saue

(base) And after that
we conseille that in thyn hous thow sette suffisant garnyson so that they may as wel thy body as thyn hous defende

(base) But certes for to moeue werre ne sodeynly for to doon
vengeance we may nat deme in so litel tyme that it were
profitable
(base) wher fore we axen leyser and espace to haue deliberacioun in this cas to deme

(base) for the commune prouerbe seyth
this he that soone demeth soone shal repente

(base) And eek men
seyn that thilke Iuge is wys
Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
that soone vnderstondeth a matere and Iuggeth by leyser

(base) for al be it so that al taryyng be
anoyful algates it is nat to repreue in yeuyng of Iuggement ne in vengeance takyng whan it is suffisant and
resonable

(base) and that shewed oure lord Ihus crist by ensample for whan that the womman that was taken in auoutrye
was broght in his presence to knowen what sholde be doon
with hir persone al be it that he wiste wel hym self what
that he wolde answere yet ne wolde he nat answere sodeynly but he wolde haue deliberacioun and in the ground he
wroot twies

(base) and bythise causes we axen deliberacion
and we shul thanne by the grace of god conseille thee thyng
that shal be profitable

(base) Vp stirten thanne the yonge folk
atones and the mooste partie of that compaignye han scorned this olde wise man and bigonnen to make noyse and
seyden that

(base) right so as whil that
Iren is hoot men sholde smyte right so sholde men wreken hir wronges
whil that they been fresshe and newe and with loud voys
they criden werre werre

(base) vp roos tho oon of thise olde
wise and with his hand made contenance that men sholde
holden hem stille and yeuen hym audience

(base) Lordynges quod he ther is ful many a man that crieth werre
werre that woot ful litel what werre amounteth

(base) Werre at his bigynnyng hath so greet an entree and so large
that euery wight may entre whan hym liketh and lightly fynde werre

(base) But certes what ende that ther of shal falle it
is noght light to knowe

(base) for soothly whan that werre is ones
bigonne ther is ful many a child vnborn of his moder
that shal sterue yong by cause of thilke werre or ellis lyue in
sorwe and dye in wrecchednesse

(base) and ther fore er that any werre
be bigonne men moste haue gret conseil and gret deliberacioun

(base) And whan this olde man wende to enforcen his tale by resons
wel neigh all atones bigonne they

to rise for to breken his tale and beden hym ful ofte hise wordes for to abregge

(base) for sothly he that precheth to hem that listen nat heren hise wordes hys
sarmon hem anoyeth

(base) For Ihus Syrak seith That Musyk in
wepynge is a noyous thyng This is to seyn As muche auaileth to speken biforn folk to whiche his speche anoyeth as it
is to synge biforn hym that wepeth

(base) And whan this wise man
say that hym wanted audience al shamefast he sette hym doun
agayn

(base) For Salomon seith ther as thow ne mayst haue non
audience enforce thee nat to speke

(base) I se wel quod this wise
man that the come prouerbe is sooth that good conseil wanteth
whan it is moost nede

(base) yet hadde this Melibeus in his conseil many folk that priuely in his ere conseiled hym certeyn
thyng and conseiled hym the contrarie in general audience

(base) Whan Melibeus hadde herd that the gretteste party of his conseil were acorded that he sholde make werre anon he consented
to hir conseilyng and fully
affermed hir sentence

(base) Thanne dame Prudence whan that she say how that hyr
housbonde shoope hym for to wreke hym on his foos and to
bigynne werre she in ful humble wise whan she say hir
tyme seyde hym thise wordes

(base) My lord quod she I you
biseche as hertely as I dar and kan ne haste yow nat to
faste and for alle gerdons as yif me audience

(base) For Piers
Alfonce seith who so that dooth to thee outher good or
harm haste thee nat to quiten it for in this wise thy
freend wol abyde and thyn enemy shal the lenger lyue
in drede

(base) The prouerbe seith he hasteth wel that wysly kan
abide and in wikked haste is no profit

(base) This Melibe answerde vn to his wyf Prudence I purpose nat quod he
to werken by thy conseil for many causes and resons
for certes euery wight wolde holde me thanne a fool

(base) this is to seyn If I for thy conseilyng wolde chaunge
thynges that ben ordeyned and affermed
Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
by so manye wise

(base) Secoundly I seye that alle wommen ben wikke and noon good of hem alle
for of a thousand men seith Salomon I foond o good man but
certes of alle wommen good womman foond I neuere

(base) And also certes
if I gouerned me by thy conseil it sholde seme that I hadde yeue
to thee ouer me the maistrie and goddes forbode that it so were

(base) For Ihus Syrak seith that if the wyf haue maistrie she is
contrarious to hir housbonde

(base) And Salomon seith Neuere
in thy lyf to thy wyf ne to thy child ne to thy freend ne yif
no power ouer thy self For bettre it were that thy children
axen of thy persone thynges that hem nedeth than thow see
thy self in the handes of thy children

(base) And also if I wolde
werke by thy conseilyng certes my conseil moste som tyme be
secree til it were tyme that it moste be knowe and this ne
may nat be

(base) Whan Dame Prudence ful debonairly and with
gret pacience hadde herd al that hir housbonde liked for to
seye thanne axed she of hym licence for to speke and
seyde in this wise

(base) My lord quod she as to youre firste
reson
certes it may lightly been answered for I seye that it is
no folie to chaunge conseil whan the thyng is chaunged
or ellis whan the thyng semeth oother weys than it was
biforn

(base) And moore ouer I seye that thogh that ye han sworn
and bihight to perfourne youre emprise and nathelees ye weyue
to perfourne thilke same emprise by iuste cause men sholde nat seyn therfore that ye were a lyere ne forsworn

(base) for
the book seith that the wise man maketh no lesyng whan
he turneth his corage to the bettre

(base) And al be it so that youre
emprise be establissed and ordeyned by gret multitude of folk
yet thar ye nat accomplice thilke same ordinance but yow
like

(base) for the trouthe of thynges and the profit ben rather founde
in fewe folk that ben wise and ful of reson than by gret multitude of folk ther euery man crieth and clatereth what that hym
liketh soothly swich multitude is nat honeste

(base) And to the
Seconde resoun where as ye seyn that alle wommen ben wikke
Saue youre grace certes ye despise alle wommen in this wyse
and he that al despiseth
Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
al displeseth as seith the book

(base) and
Senec seith that who so wole haue Sapience shal no man
dispreise but he shal gladly teche the science that he kan with
oute presumpcion or pride

(base) and swiche thynges as he noght
ne kan he shal nat ben ashamed to lerne hem and enquere
of lasse folk than hym self

(base) And sire that ther hath be ful many
a good womman may lightly be preued

(base) for certes sire oure lord
Ihus crist wolde neuere han descended to be born of a womman
if alle wommen hadde be wikke

(base) And after that for the grete
bountee that is in wommen oure lord Ihus crist whan he was risen
fro deth to lyf appered rather to a womman than to his apostles

(base) And though that Salomon seith that he ne foond neuere
womman good it folweth nat therfore that alle wommen
ben wikke

(base) for thogh that he ne foond no good womman certes
many another man hath founde many a womman ful good
and trewe

(base) Or ellis parauenture the entente of Salomon was
this that as in souereyn bountee he foond no womman

(base) this is
to seyn that ther is
no wight that hath souereyn bountee saue
god allone as he hym self recordeth in his Euangelie

(base) for
ther nys no creature so good that hym ne wanteth som what
of the perfeccioun of god that is his makere

(base) Youre thridde reson is this ye seyn that if ye gouerne yow by my conseil it
sholde seme that ye hadde yeue me the maistrie and the lordshipe ouer youre persone

(base) Sire sauf youre grace it is nat so
for if so were that no man sholde be conseiled but oonly of
hem that hadde lordshipe and maistrie of his persone men wolde nat ben conseiled so ofte

(base) for soothly thilke man that axeth
conseil of a purpos yet hath he free choys wheither he
wole werke by that conseil or noon

(base) And as to youre ferthe
reson ther ye seyn that the Ianglerye of wommen kan hide
thynges that they woot nat as who seith that a womman
kan nat hide that that she woot

(base) Sire thise wordes been
vnderstonde of wommen that ben Iangleresses and wikked

(base) of
whiche wommen men seyn that thre thynges dryuen a man
out of his hous that is to seyn Smoke droppyng of
reyn and wikked wyues

(base) and of swiche wommen seith Salomon that it were bettre dwellen in desert than with a womman
that is riotous

(base) and sire
by youre leue that am nat I

(base) for ye han
ful ofte assayed my grete silence and my grete pacience and
eek how wel that I kan hiden and hele thynges that men oghten
secrely to hyde

(base) And soothly as to youre fifthe reson wher-
as ye seyn that in wikked conseil wommen venquysse men
god woot thilke reson stant heere in no stede
(base) For vnderstond now ye axen conseil to do wikkednesse

(base) and if ye
wol werke wikkednesse and youre wyf restreyneth thilke
wikked purpos and ouercometh yow by reson and by good conseil

(base) certes youre
wyf oghte rather be preysed than yblamed
(base) Thus sholde ye vnderstonde the Philosophre that seith In wikked conseil wommen venquyssen hir housbondes

(base) And ther as ye blamen alle wommen
and hir resons
I shal shewe by manye ensamples that many a
womman hath be ful good and yet ben and hir conseils holsom
and profitable
(base) Eke som men han seyd that the conseilyng of wommen is outher to deere or ellis to litel of prys

(base) but al be it
so that ful many a womman
is badde and hir conseil vile and noght
worth yet han men founde ful many a good womman and ful
discrete and wys in conseilynge

(base) Lo Iacob by conseil of his
moder Rebekka wan the beneyson of Ysaak his fader and
the lordshipe ouer alle his bretheren

(base) Iudith by hir good conseil
deliuered the Citee of Bethulye in which she dwelled out of the
handes of Olofernus that hadde it biseged and wolde it al destroye

(base) Abigail deliuered Nabal hir housbonde fro Dauid the kyng that
wolde han slayn hym and apaised the Ire of the kyng by hir
wit and by hir good conseilyng

(base) Hester by hir good conseil enhaunced gretly the peple of god in the regne of Assuerus the
kyng

(base) and the same bountee in good conseilyng of many a good
womman may men telle

(base) And moore ouer whan that oure lord

hadde creat Adam oure forme fader he seyde in this wise

were nat goode and hir conseil good and profitable

(base) oure lord god
of heuene wolde neither han wroght hem ne called hem
help of man but rather confusion of man

no thyng

(base) And ther fore sire if ye wol truste to my conseil I shal restore yow youre doghter hool and sound

to yow so muche that ye shul haue honour in this cause
(base) Whan Melibe hadde herd the wordes of his wyf Prudence he seyde thus

(base) I se wel that the word of Salomon is
sooth he
seith that wordes that ben spoken discretly by ordinance beth honycombes for they yeue swetnesse to the soule
and holsomnesse to the body

(base) And wyf by cause of the swete
wordes and eek for I haue assayed and preued thy grete sapience
and thy grete trouthe I wol gouerne me by thy conseil in alle

how ye shal gouerne yow self in chesynge of youre conseilours

(base) Ye shal first in alle youre werkes mekely biseken to the heighe
god that he wol be youre conseillour

(base) and shapeth yow to swich
entente that he yeue yow conseil and confort as taughte Thobie
his sone

(base) At alle tymes thow shalt blesse god and praye hym
to dresse thy weyes and looke that alle thy conseils ben in hym
for euere moore

nede of Sapience axe it of god

(base) and afterward thanne shal ye
take conseil

in your self and examyne wel youre thoghtes of
swiche thynges as yow thynketh that is best for youre profit

(base) and
thanne shal ye dryue fro youre herte thre thynges that been
contrariouse to good conseil
(base) that is to seyn Ire Coueitise and hastynesse

(base) First he that axeth conseil of hym self certes he moste be
